title: Drawing, "International Casino: Elevations", June 15, 1937
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamps: Architect's stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE, NEW YORK CITY; see inscription.
inscribed: Office stamp at lower right inscribed in graphite: 546-67; 1/4"=1'-0"; INT. CAS.; LYKOS. / 6/15/37 [6 crossed out to read 7]; 6/15/37, 1,BRECKER / 6/15/37, 2, WEISS / 6/16/37,5,BRECKER. Inscribed in graphite at lower center: ELEVATIONS OF INTERNATIONAL CASINO/ SCALE 1/4"=1'0". Inscribed in graphite throughout with names and descriptions of eleven (11) different elevations.
description: Eleven different wall elevations for the International Casino, New York City. From left to right at top: East elevation through 45th Street lobby shows door at left, walls in East India Rose Flex wood. Plan for ladies powder room with toilet in lower left of room, telephone booth at right with row of seats along right wall. Upper wall at right is area with mirrors and shelves, entrance in upper right corner; powder room west elevation has long rectangular mirror at left over glass shelf, light reflector above mirror, door near center, paint or wallpaper on walls; powder room east elevation has long rectangular mirror along width of wall at center, door at left. Rear elevation of bar on first floor shows white sycamore, long rectangular bar at left. East India Rose Flex Wood on wall behind bar, door at right. Second floor elevations indicate continuous bench along wall, columns, and mural on wall.  First floor south elevation has stainless steel revolving food bar at left, blank wall of East India Rose Flex Wood to right. At lower center of elevation is continuous bench along wall, with mural above bench, mirrored column at center and mirrored wall at right. First floor interior of entrance elevation shows three sets of double-door entrances at right, mural above doors. First floor north elevation toward entrance at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "International Casino: Elevations", June 15, 1937.
June 15, 1937. Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-271.
